For your consideration: 

An epic Arcane Archer with the ability to hide, rain enchanted and enhanced 6d6 DA. Then when spotted, he'll open up some suppressing fire allowing the tanks to roll in.

UMD? check
Some music to kill things by? check
Open locks and Disable traps? check
Set traps prior to luring a mark that *might* survive the DA? not so much (feel free to spitball on solutions)
I'm not 100% on the class splits..and there's room for wiggle depending on your preferred flavor. Like a stronger sneak? Add a few more assassin levels. Punchier arrows? Add to AA.

Again, not a fully baked idea, but this seems like a really strong contender.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Firstly I am not the greatest AA, Bard or Assassin player but I would say this looks solid MentalDekay!

The AB is delightful at 54. Assassin 11 is pretty solid to access the very special Assassin's Improved Invisibility. Plus UMD

To me this seems like a very strong and playable build! Well done

If you wanted some minor improvements then I have a handful of suggestions but feel free to ignore them if you wish
SpoilerI think Blind Fight should be in the build to help deal with enemies with concealment Other nice feats would be Toughness, Called shot, Resist Energy feats (If possible, not sure if you have enough fortitude to get it) or Luck of Heroes I think Dodge and Mobility might not be the best feats to take in this build as one's AC will be very high from the dex score plus protected by Uncanny Dodge from assassin. Also extra music seems low value with a level 6 Bard song.  Your pre-epic split is Bard 5 / Assassin 5 / AA 10, which could be optimised to Bard 6 / Assassin 4 / AA 10 for +1 BAB. Then take the Assassin 5 level at level 21 for the skill dump.  Assassin 9 is a pretty strong power spike on paper, and I would suggest getting that asap epic levels, if possible
